SCALAR

String

  • scalar String
  • BiosFilesThe BIOS Files that this Platform is known to have.
  • ConfigurationCollectionDescriptorDescribes a `ConfigurationCollection` with the keys of each section.
  • ConfigurationOptionDescriptorDescribes a configuration option.
  • ConfigurationSectionA configuration section is a grouping of related `ConfigurationOptions`.
  • ConfigurationSectionDescriptorDescribes a `ConfigurationSection` with its human readable name and description.
  • ConfigurationValueThe value of a single configuration option key.
  • ControllerElementInfoA layout element of a controller in a controller layout.
  • ControllerLayoutA Stone Controller Layout
  • ControllerLayoutEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `ControllerLayout`.
  • CustomMetadataCustom metadata for usually flag options.
  • DefaultMappedControllerElementCollectionInputnull
  • EmulatedControllerInputnull
  • EmulatorAn emulator plugin.
  • EmulatorEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `Emulator`.
  • EmulatorTaskResultThe result of a running task.
  • EnumIntValueBoxes a CLR Enum into its numeric value, and the enumeration name.
  • FileRecordA record of a file related to a game or other metadatable record.
  • FileRecordEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `FileRecord`.
  • FileRecordInputnull
  • FileTypeA FileType is defined by its common extension, and a mimetype, usually of
  • GameRecordA record of an executable Game
  • GameRecordEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `GameRecord`.
  • GameRecordInputnull
  • InputDeviceDescribes an enumerated input device with a determined layout.
  • InputDeviceEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `InputDevice`.
  • InputDeviceInputnull
  • LowLevelInputDeviceDescribes an attached input device at the input API level.
  • LowLevelInputDeviceEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `LowLevelInputDevice`.
  • MappedControllerElementCollectionA collection of mapped controller elements. Essentially a mapping profile from a real device to an emulated virtual device.
  • MappedControllerElementCollectionInputnull
  • Metadatanull
  • ModuleA module installed in the modules folder.
  • ModuleEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `Module`.
  • PageInfoInformation about pagination in a connection.
  • PlatformInfoA Stone Platform Definition.
  • PlatformInfoEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `PlatformInfo`.
  • PluginA loadable Snowflake plugin managed by the plugin manager.
  • PluginEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `Plugin`.
  • PluginInterfaceA loadable Snowflake plugin managed by the plugin manager.
  • QueryThe query root of Snowflake's GraphQL interface
  • RecordMetadataA piece of metadata associated with a record.
  • RecordMetadataInputAn input type for a piece of record metadata.
  • ScraperA scraper plugin produces seeds to create game records.
  • ScraperEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `Scraper`.
  • SeedA seed represents a piece of data in the process of scraping a game.
  • SeedContentA content of the seed.
  • SeedTreeInputnull
  • SelectionOptionDescriptorDescribes a single valid enumerated selection option
  • StringConnectionA connection from an object to a list of objects of type `String`.
  • StringEdgeAn edge in a connection from an object to another object of type `String`.
  • StringValueBoxes a `String` scalar into an ObjectGraphType.
  • __DirectiveA Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document. In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.
  • __EnumValueOne possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.
  • __FieldObject and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.
  • __InputValueArguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.
  • __TypeThe fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum. Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.
